consul.description:
Registers services and checks for an agent with a consul cluster. A service is some process running on the agent node that should be advertised by consul's discovery mechanism. It may optionally supply a check definition, a periodic service test to notify the consul cluster of service's health.
Checks may also be registered per node e.g. disk usage, or cpu usage and notify the health of the entire node to the cluster. Service level checks do not require a check name or id as these are derived by Consul from the Service name and id respectively by appending 'service:' Node level checks require a check_name and optionally a check_id.
Currently, there is no complete way to retrieve the script, interval or ttl metadata for a registered check. Without this metadata it is  not possible to tell if the data supplied with ansible represents a change to a check. As a result this does not attempt to determine changes and will always report a changed occurred. An api method is planned to supply this metadata so at that stage change management will be added.
See http://consul.io for more details.

interval.description:
Default: None

the interval at which the service check will be run. This is a number with a s or m suffix to signify the units of seconds or minutes e.g 15s or 1m. If no suffix is supplied, m will be used by default e.g. 1 will be 1m. Required if the script param is specified.

http.description:
Default: None

checks can be registered with an http endpoint. This means that consul will check that the http endpoint returns a successful http status. Interval must also be provided with this option.

tags.description:
Default: None

a list of tags that will be attached to the service registration.

check_name.description:
Default: None

a name for the service check, defaults to the check id. required if standalone, ignored if part of service definition.

service_name.description: Unique name for the service on a node, must be unique per node, required if registering a service. May be ommitted if registering a node level check

notes.description:
Default: None

Notes to attach to check when registering it.

script.description:
Default: None

the script/command that will be run periodically to check the health of the service. Scripts require an interval and vise versa

token.description:
Default: None

the token key indentifying an ACL rule set. May be required to register services.

check_id.description:
Default: None

an ID for the service check, defaults to the check name, ignored if part of a service definition.

host.description:
Default: localhost

host of the consul agent defaults to localhost

state.description: register or deregister the consul service, defaults to present

service_port.description: the port on which the service is listening required for registration of a service, i.e. if service_name or service_id is set

timeout.description:
Default: None

A custom HTTP check timeout. The consul default is 10 seconds. Similar to the interval this is a number with a s or m suffix to signify the units of seconds or minutes, e.g. 15s or 1m.

ttl.description:
Default: None

checks can be registered with a ttl instead of a script and interval this means that the service will check in with the agent before the ttl expires. If it doesn't the check will be considered failed. Required if registering a check and the script an interval are missing Similar to the interval this is a number with a s or m suffix to signify the units of seconds or minutes e.g 15s or 1m. If no suffix is supplied, m will be used by default e.g. 1 will be 1m

service_id.description:
Default: service_name if supplied

the ID for the service, must be unique per node, defaults to the service name if the service name is supplied

port.description:
Default: 8500

the port on which the consul agent is running

This option is required on RHEL-based distributions

name.description: The generic name of the link.

gce_lb.description: This module can create and destroy Google Compute Engine C(loadbalancer) and C(httphealthcheck) resources.  The primary LB resource is the C(load_balancer) resource and the health check parameters are all prefixed with I(httphealthcheck). The full documentation for Google Compute Engine load balancing is at U(https://developers.google.com/compute/docs/load-balancing/).  However, the ansible module simplifies the configuration by following the libcloud model. Full install/configuration instructions for the gce* modules can be found in the comments of ansible/test/gce_tests.py.

Default: tcp

the protocol used for the load-balancer packet forwarding, tcp or udp

region.description: the GCE region where the load-balancer is defined

httphealthcheck_healthy_count.description:
Default: 2

number of consecutive successful checks before marking a node healthy

httphealthcheck_path.description:
Default: /

the url path to use for HTTP health checking

port_range.description: the port (range) to forward, e.g. 80 or 8000-8888 defaults to all ports

state.description:
Default: present

desired state of the LB

httphealthcheck_timeout.description:
Default: 5

the timeout in seconds before a request is considered a failed check

members.description: a list of zone/nodename pairs, e.g ['us-central1-a/www-a', ...]

httphealthcheck_port.description:
Default: 80

the TCP port to use for HTTP health checking

httphealthcheck_name.description: the name identifier for the HTTP health check

nodes.description: a list of zone/nodename pairs, e.g ['us-central1-a/www-a', ...]

httphealthcheck_interval.description:
Default: 5

the duration in seconds between each health check request

This module de-registers or registers an AWS EC2 instance from the ELBs that it belongs to.
Returns fact "ec2_elbs" which is a list of elbs attached to the instance if state=absent is passed as an argument.
Will be marked changed when called only if there are ELBs found to operate on.

Default: True

Wait for instance registration or deregistration to complete successfully before returning.

consul_session.description: allows the addition, modification and deletion of sessions in a consul cluster. These sessions can then be used in conjunction with key value pairs to implement distributed locks. In depth documentation for working with sessions can be found here http://www.consul.io/docs/internals/sessions.html

node.description:
Default: None

the name of the node that with which the session will be associated. by default this is the name of the agent.

datacenter.description:
Default: None

name of the datacenter in which the session exists or should be created.

name.description:
Default: None

the name that should be associated with the session. This is opaque to Consul and not required.

host.description:
Default: localhost

host of the consul agent defaults to localhost

port.description:
Default: 8500

the port on which the consul agent is running

delay.description:
Default: 15s

the optional lock delay that can be attached to the session when it is created. Locks for invalidated sessions ar blocked from being acquired until this delay has expired. Valid units for delays include 'ns', 'us', 'ms', 's', 'm', 'h'

state.description:
Default: present

whether the session should be present i.e. created if it doesn't exist, or absent, removed if present. If created, the ID for the session is returned in the output. If absent, the name or ID is required to remove the session. Info for a single session, all the sessions for a node or all available sessions can be retrieved by specifying info, node or list for the state; for node or info, the node name or session id is required as parameter.

checks.description:
Default: None

a list of checks that will be used to verify the session health. If all the checks fail, the session will be invalidated and any locks associated with the session will be release and can be acquired once the associated lock delay has expired.

ec2_win_password.description: Gets the default administrator password from any EC2 Windows instance.  The instance is referenced by its id (e.g. i-XXXXXXX). This module has a dependency on python-boto.

instance_id.description: The instance id to get the password data from.

key_file.description: Path to the file containing the key pair used on the instance.

wait_timeout.description:
Default: 120

Number of seconds to wait before giving up.

key_passphrase.description: The passphrase for the instance key pair. The key must use DES or 3DES encryption for this module to decrypt it. You can use openssl to convert your password protected keys if they do not use DES or 3DES. ex) openssl rsa -in current_key -out new_key -des3.

wait.description:
Default: no

Whether or not to wait for the password to be available before returning.

specify 0 to wait forever

volume_id.description: volume from which to take the snapshot

last_snapshot_min_age.description: If the volume's most recent snapshot has started less than `last_snapshot_min_age' minutes ago, a new snapshot will not be created.

wait.description:
Default: True

wait for the snapshot to be ready

cron.description:
Use this module to manage crontab entries. This module allows you to create named crontab entries, update, or delete them.
The module includes one line with the description of the crontab entry C("#Ansible: <name>") corresponding to the "name" passed to the module, which is used by future ansible/module calls to find/check the state.  The "name" parameter should be unique, and changing the "name" value will result in a new cron task being created (or a different one being removed)

name.description: Description of a crontab entry. Required if state=absent

hour.description:
Default: *

Hour when the job should run ( 0-23, *, */2, etc )

state.description:
Default: present

Whether to ensure the job is present or absent.

dow.description:
Default: *

Day of the week that the job should run ( 0-6 for Sunday-Saturday, *, etc )

dom.description:
Default: *

Day of the month the job should run ( 1-31, *, */2, etc )

cron_file.description: If specified, uses this file in cron.d instead of an individual user's crontab. To use the C(cron_file) parameter you must specify the C(user) as well.

reboot.description:
Default: no

If the job should be run at reboot. This option is deprecated. Users should use special_time.

month.description:
Default: *

Month of the year the job should run ( 1-12, *, */2, etc )

disabled.description: If the job should be disabled (commented out) in the crontab. Only has effect if state=present

job.description: The command to execute. Required if state=present.

user.description:
Default: root

The specific user whose crontab should be modified.

backup.description: If set, create a backup of the crontab before it is modified. The location of the backup is returned in the C(backup_file) variable by this module.

day.description:
Default: *

Day of the month the job should run ( 1-31, *, */2, etc )

minute.description:
Default: *

Minute when the job should run ( 0-59, *, */2, etc )

weekday.description:
Default: *

Day of the week that the job should run ( 0-6 for Sunday-Saturday, *, etc )

rax_cdb.description: creates / deletes or resize a Rackspace Cloud Databases instance and optionally waits for it to be 'running'. The name option needs to be unique since it's used to identify the instance.

cdb_type.description:
Default: MySQL

type of instance (i.e. MySQL, MariaDB, Percona)

name.description: Name of the databases server instance

cdb_version.description: version of database (MySQL supports 5.1 and 5.6, MariaDB supports 10, Percona supports 5.6)

volume.description:
Default: 2

Volume size of the database 1-150GB

state.description:
Default: present

Indicate desired state of the resource

wait_timeout.description:
Default: 300

how long before wait gives up, in seconds

flavor.description:
Default: 1

flavor to use for the instance 1 to 6 (i.e. 512MB to 16GB)

wait.description:
Default: no

wait for the instance to be in state 'running' before returning

ec2_vpc_subnet_facts.description: Gather facts about ec2 VPC subnets in AWS

filters.description: A dict of filters to apply. Each dict item consists of a filter key and a filter value. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeSubnets.html) for possible filters.

environment.description: The airbrake environment name, typically 'production', 'staging', etc.

url.description:
Default: https://airbrake.io/deploys

Optional URL to submit the notification to. Use to send notifications to Airbrake-compliant tools like Errbit.

user.description: The username of the person doing the deployment

validate_certs.description:
Default: yes

If C(no), SSL certificates for the target url will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

revision.description: A hash, number, tag, or other identifier showing what revision was deployed

find.description: Return a list files based on specific criteria. Multiple criteria are AND'd together.

paths.description: List of paths to the file or directory to search. All paths must be fully qualified.

name.description: List of paths to the file or directory to search. All paths must be fully qualified.

file_type.description:
Default: file

Type of file to select

pattern.description:
Default: *

One or more (shell or regex) patterns, which type is controled by C(use_regex) option.
The patterns restrict the list of files to be returned to those whose basenames match at least one of the patterns specified. Multiple patterns can be specified using a list.

age.description: Select files whose age is equal to or greater than the specified time. Use a negative age to find files equal to or less than the specified time. You can choose seconds, minutes, hours, days, or weeks by specifying the first letter of any of those words (e.g., "1w").

contains.description: One or more re patterns which should be matched against the file content

recurse.description:
Default: no

If target is a directory, recursively descend into the directory looking for files.

age_stamp.description:
Default: mtime

Choose the file property against which we compare age. Default is mtime.

patterns.description:
Default: *

One or more (shell or regex) patterns, which type is controled by C(use_regex) option.
The patterns restrict the list of files to be returned to those whose basenames match at least one of the patterns specified. Multiple patterns can be specified using a list.

get_checksum.description:
Default: False

Set this to true to retrieve a file's sha1 checksum

follow.description:
Default: False

Set this to true to follow symlinks in path for systems with python 2.6+

use_regex.description:
Default: False

If false the patterns are file globs (shell) if true they are python regexes

path.description: List of paths to the file or directory to search. All paths must be fully qualified.

hidden.description:
Default: False

Set this to true to include hidden files, otherwise they'll be ignored.

size.description: Select files whose size is equal to or greater than the specified size. Use a negative size to find files equal to or less than the specified size. Unqualified values are in bytes, but b, k, m, g, and t can be appended to specify bytes, kilobytes, megabytes, gigabytes, and terabytes, respectively. Size is not evaluated for directories.

jboss.description: Deploy applications to JBoss standalone using the filesystem

src.description: The remote path of the application ear or war to deploy

deploy_path.description:
Default: /var/lib/jbossas/standalone/deployments

The location in the filesystem where the deployment scanner listens

state.description:
Default: present

Whether the application should be deployed or undeployed

template.description:
Templates are processed by the Jinja2 templating language (U(http://jinja.pocoo.org/docs/)) - documentation on the template formatting can be found in the Template Designer Documentation (U(http://jinja.pocoo.org/docs/templates/)).
Six additional variables can be used in templates: C(ansible_managed) (configurable via the C(defaults) section of C(ansible.cfg)) contains a string which can be used to describe the template name, host, modification time of the template file and the owner uid, C(template_host) contains the node name of the template's machine, C(template_uid) the owner, C(template_path) the absolute path of the template, C(template_fullpath) is the absolute path of the template, and C(template_run_date) is the date that the template was rendered. Note that including a string that uses a date in the template will result in the template being marked 'changed' each time.

dest.description: Location to render the template to on the remote machine.

src.description: Path of a Jinja2 formatted template on the local server. This can be a relative or absolute path.

force.description:
Default: yes

the default is C(yes), which will replace the remote file when contents are different than the source.  If C(no), the file will only be transferred if the destination does not exist.

backup.description:
Default: no

Create a backup file including the timestamp information so you can get the original file back if you somehow clobbered it incorrectly.

ec2_ami_find.description:
Returns list of matching AMIs with AMI ID, along with other useful information
Can search AMIs with different owners
Can search by matching tag(s), by AMI name and/or other criteria
Results can be sorted and sliced

sort.description:
Optional attribute which with to sort the results.
If specifying 'tag', the 'tag_name' parameter is required.

no_result_action.description:
Default: success

What to do when no results are found.
'success' reports success and returns an empty array
'fail' causes the module to report failure

sort_end.description:
Which result to end with (when sorting).
Corresponds to Python slice notation.

name.description: An AMI name to match.

hypervisor.description: A hypervisor type type to match (e.g. xen).

sort_start.description:
Which result to start with (when sorting).
Corresponds to Python slice notation.

ami_tags.description: A hash/dictionary of tags to match for the AMI.

state.description:
Default: available

AMI state to match.

sort_order.description:
Default: ascending

Order in which to sort results.
Only used when the 'sort' parameter is specified.

architecture.description: An architecture type to match (e.g. x86_64).

owner.description:
Search AMIs owned by the specified owner
Can specify an AWS account ID, or one of the special IDs 'self', 'amazon' or 'aws-marketplace'
If not specified, all EC2 AMIs in the specified region will be searched.
You can include wildcards in many of the search options. An asterisk (*) matches zero or more characters, and a question mark (?) matches exactly one character. You can escape special characters using a backslash (\) before the character. For example, a value of \*amazon\?\ searches for the literal string *amazon?\.

is_public.description: Whether or not the image(s) are public.

sort_tag.description:
Tag name with which to sort results.
Required when specifying 'sort=tag'.

ec2_ami_search.description:
Look up the most recent AMI on AWS for a given operating system.
Returns C(ami), C(aki), C(ari), C(serial), C(tag)
If there is no AKI or ARI associated with an image, these will be C(null).
Only supports images from cloud-images.ubuntu.com
Example output: C({"ami": "ami-69f5a900", "changed": false, "aki": "aki-88aa75e1", "tag": "release", "ari": null, "serial": "20131024"})

release.description: short name of the release (e.g., C(precise))

store.description:
Default: ebs

Back-end store for instance

rds_param_group.description: Creates, modifies, and deletes RDS parameter groups. This module has a dependency on python-boto >= 2.5.

engine.description: The type of database for this group. Required for state=present.

name.description: Database parameter group identifier.

immediate.description: Whether to apply the changes immediately, or after the next reboot of any associated instances.

state.description:
Default: present

Specifies whether the group should be present or absent.

params.description: Map of parameter names and values. Numeric values may be represented as K for kilo (1024), M for mega (1024^2), G for giga (1024^3), or T for tera (1024^4), and these values will be expanded into the appropriate number before being set in the parameter group.

description.description: Database parameter group description. Only set when a new group is added.

xenserver_facts.description: Reads data out of XenAPI, can be used instead of multiple xe commands.

subnets.description: List of subnet IDs that make up the Elasticache subnet group.

Specifies whether the subnet should be present or absent.

name.description: Database subnet group identifier.

login_user.description:
Default: dbadmin

The username used to authenticate with.

value.description: Value of the parameter to be set.

cluster.description:
Default: localhost

Name of the Vertica cluster.

login_password.description: The password used to authenticate with.

port.description:
Default: 5433

Vertica cluster port to connect to.

username.description: The username of the vSphere vCenter

datacenter_name.description: Name of the datacenter to add the host

admin.description: The username of the vSphere vCenter

Default: present

Add or remove the host

rds.description: Creates, deletes, or modifies rds instances.  When creating an instance it can be either a new instance or a read-only replica of an existing instance. This module has a dependency on python-boto >= 2.5. The 'promote' command requires boto >= 2.18.0. Certain features such as tags rely on boto.rds2 (boto >= 2.26.0)

db_engine.description: The type of database.  Used only when command=create.

force_failover.description:
Default: no

Used only when command=reboot.  If enabled, the reboot is done using a MultiAZ failover.

iops.description: Specifies the number of IOPS for the instance.  Used only when command=create or command=modify. Must be an integer greater than 1000.

backup_window.description: Backup window in format of hh24:mi-hh24:mi.  If not specified then a random backup window is assigned. Used only when command=create or command=modify.

backup_retention.description: Number of days backups are retained.  Set to 0 to disable backups.  Default is 1 day.  Valid range: 0-35. Used only when command=create or command=modify.

port.description:
Default: 3306 for mysql, 1521 for Oracle, 1433 for SQL Server, 5432 for PostgreSQL.

Port number that the DB instance uses for connections. Used only when command=create or command=replicate.
Prior to 2.0 it always defaults to null and the API would use 3306, it had to be set to other DB default values when not using MySql. Starting at 2.0 it auotmaticaly defaults to what is expected for each c(db_engine).

security_groups.description: Comma separated list of one or more security groups.  Used only when command=create or command=modify.

size.description: Size in gigabytes of the initial storage for the DB instance. Used only when command=create or command=modify.

aws_secret_key.description: AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.

subnet.description: VPC subnet group.  If specified then a VPC instance is created. Used only when command=create.

vpc_security_groups.description: Comma separated list of one or more vpc security group ids. Also requires `subnet` to be specified. Used only when command=create or command=modify.

upgrade.description: Indicates that minor version upgrades should be applied automatically. Used only when command=create or command=replicate.

zone.description: availability zone in which to launch the instance. Used only when command=create, command=replicate or command=restore.

source_instance.description: Name of the database to replicate. Used only when command=replicate.

parameter_group.description: Name of the DB parameter group to associate with this instance.  If omitted then the RDS default DBParameterGroup will be used. Used only when command=create or command=modify.

snapshot.description: Name of snapshot to take. When command=delete, if no snapshot name is provided then no snapshot is taken. If used with command=delete with no instance_name, the snapshot is deleted. Used with command=facts, command=delete or command=snapshot.

multi_zone.description: Specifies if this is a Multi-availability-zone deployment. Can not be used in conjunction with zone parameter. Used only when command=create or command=modify.

new_instance_name.description: Name to rename an instance to. Used only when command=modify.

username.description: Master database username. Used only when command=create.

access_key.description: AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.

tags.description: tags dict to apply to a resource. Used with command=create, command=replicate, command=restore. Requires boto >= 2.26.0

aws_region.description: The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used.

db_name.description: Name of a database to create within the instance.  If not specified then no database is created. Used only when command=create.

license_model.description: The license model for this DB instance. Used only when command=create or command=restore.

ec2_access_key.description: AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.

ec2_secret_key.description: AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.

apply_immediately.description: Used only when command=modify.  If enabled, the modifications will be applied as soon as possible rather than waiting for the next preferred maintenance window.

wait.description:
Default: no

When command=create, replicate, modify or restore then wait for the database to enter the 'available' state.  When command=delete wait for the database to be terminated.

aws_zone.description: availability zone in which to launch the instance. Used only when command=create, command=replicate or command=restore.

aws_access_key.description: AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.

ec2_region.description: The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used.

character_set_name.description: Associate the DB instance with a specified character set. Used with command=create.

region.description: The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used.

option_group.description: The name of the option group to use.  If not specified then the default option group is used. Used only when command=create.

engine_version.description: Version number of the database engine to use. Used only when command=create. If not specified then the current Amazon RDS default engine version is used.

ec2_zone.description: availability zone in which to launch the instance. Used only when command=create, command=replicate or command=restore.

instance_name.description: Database instance identifier. Required except when using command=facts or command=delete on just a snapshot

instance_type.description: The instance type of the database.  Must be specified when command=create. Optional when command=replicate, command=modify or command=restore. If not specified then the replica inherits the same instance type as the source instance.

password.description: Password for the master database username. Used only when command=create or command=modify.

wait_timeout.description:
Default: 300

how long before wait gives up, in seconds

command.description: Specifies the action to take. The 'reboot' option is available starting at version 2.0

publicly_accessible.description: explicitly set whether the resource should be publicly accessible or not. Used with command=create, command=replicate. Requires boto >= 2.26.0

secret_key.description: AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.

maint_window.description: Maintenance window in format of ddd:hh24:mi-ddd:hh24:mi.  (Example: Mon:22:00-Mon:23:15) If not specified then a random maintenance window is assigned. Used only when command=create or command=modify.

consul_kv.description:
Allows the addition, modification and deletion of key/value entries in a consul cluster via the agent. The entire contents of the record, including the indices, flags and session are returned as 'value'.
If the key represents a prefix then Note that when a value is removed, the existing value if any is returned as part of the results.
See http://www.consul.io/docs/agent/http.html#kv for more details.

cas.description:
Default: None

used when acquiring a lock with a session. If the cas is 0, then Consul will only put the key if it does not already exist. If the cas value is non-zero, then the key is only set if the index matches the ModifyIndex of that key.

recurse.description: if the key represents a prefix, each entry with the prefix can be retrieved by setting this to true.

state.description:
Default: present

the action to take with the supplied key and value. If the state is 'present', the key contents will be set to the value supplied, 'changed' will be set to true only if the value was different to the current contents. The state 'absent' will remove the key/value pair, again 'changed' will be set to true only if the key actually existed prior to the removal. An attempt can be made to obtain or free the lock associated with a key/value pair with the states 'acquire' or 'release' respectively. a valid session must be supplied to make the attempt changed will be true if the attempt is successful, false otherwise.

value.description: the value should be associated with the given key, required if state is present

token.description:
Default: None

the token key indentifying an ACL rule set that controls access to the key value pair

session.description:
Default: None

the session that should be used to acquire or release a lock associated with a key/value pair

flags.description:
Default: None

opaque integer value that can be passed when setting a value.

key.description: the key at which the value should be stored.

host.description:
Default: localhost

host of the consul agent defaults to localhost

port.description:
Default: 8500

the port on which the consul agent is running

ejabberd_user.description: This module provides user management for ejabberd servers

username.description: the name of the user to manage

host.description: the ejabberd host associated with this username

password.description: the password to assign to the username

logging.description: enables or disables the local syslog facility for this module

state.description:
Default: present

describe the desired state of the user to be managed

state.description:
Default: present

Whether the mailbox should exist

login_password.description: The webfaction password to use

sns_topic.description: The M(sns_topic) module allows you to create, delete, and manage subscriptions for AWS SNS topics.

display_name.description:
Default: None

Display name of the topic

name.description: The name or ARN of the SNS topic to converge

subscriptions.description: List of subscriptions to apply to the topic. Note that AWS requires subscriptions to be confirmed, so you will need to confirm any new subscriptions.

delivery_policy.description:
Default: None

Delivery policy to apply to the SNS topic

state.description:
Default: present

Whether to create or destroy an SNS topic

policy.description:
Default: None

Policy to apply to the SNS topic

purge_subscriptions.description:
Default: True

Whether to purge any subscriptions not listed here. NOTE: AWS does not allow you to purge any PendingConfirmation subscriptions, so if any exist and would be purged, they are silently skipped. This means that somebody could come back later and confirm the subscription. Sorry. Blame Amazon.

win_iis_website.description: Creates, Removes and configures a IIS Web site

hostname.description: The host header to bind to / use for the new site.

name.description: Names of web site

parameters.description: Custom site Parameters from string where properties are seperated by a pipe and property name/values by colon Ex. "foo:1|bar:2"

ip.description: The IP address to bind to / use for the new site.

physical_path.description: The physical path on the remote host to use for the new site. The specified folder must already exist.

application_pool.description: The application pool in which the new site executes.

ssl.description: Enables HTTPS binding on the site..

state.description: State of the web site

port.description: The port to bind to / use for the new site.

win_dotnet_ngen.description:
After .NET framework is installed/updated, Windows will probably want to recompile things to optimise for the host.
This happens via scheduled task, usually at some inopportune time.
This module allows you to run this task on your own schedule, so you incur the CPU hit at some more convenient and controlled time.
http://blogs.msdn.com/b/dotnet/archive/2013/08/06/wondering-why-mscorsvw-exe-has-high-cpu-usage-you-can-speed-it-up.aspx

cloudformation.description: Launches an AWS CloudFormation stack and waits for it complete.

disable_rollback.description:
Default: false

If a stacks fails to form, rollback will remove the stack

notification_arns.description: The Simple Notification Service (SNS) topic ARNs to publish stack related events.

tags.description: Dictionary of tags to associate with stack and it's resources during stack creation. Cannot be updated later. Requires at least Boto version 2.6.0.

stack_policy.description: the path of the cloudformation stack policy

region.description: The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used.

template_format.description:
Default: json

For local templates, allows specification of json or yaml format

aws_region.description: The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used.

template_parameters.description: a list of hashes of all the template variables for the stack

state.description: If state is "present", stack will be created.  If state is "present" and if stack exists and template has changed, it will be updated. If state is "absent", stack will be removed.

template_url.description: Location of file containing the template body. The URL must point to a template (max size 307,200 bytes) located in an S3 bucket in the same region as the stack. This parameter is mutually exclusive with 'template'. Either one of them is required if "state" parameter is "present"

template.description: The local path of the cloudformation template. This parameter is mutually exclusive with 'template_url'. Either one of them is required if "state" parameter is "present" Must give full path to the file, relative to the working directory. If using roles this may look like "roles/cloudformation/files/cloudformation-example.json"

ec2_region.description: The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used.

replace.description:
This module will replace all instances of a pattern within a file.
It is up to the user to maintain idempotence by ensuring that the same pattern would never match any replacements made.

name.description: The file to modify.

dest.description: The file to modify.

others.description: All arguments accepted by the M(file) module also work here.

replace.description: The string to replace regexp matches. May contain backreferences that will get expanded with the regexp capture groups if the regexp matches. If not set, matches are removed entirely.

regexp.description: The regular expression to look for in the contents of the file. Uses Python regular expressions; see U(http://docs.python.org/2/library/re.html). Uses multiline mode, which means C(^) and C($) match the beginning and end respectively of I(each line) of the file.

follow.description:
Default: no

This flag indicates that filesystem links, if they exist, should be followed.

backup.description:
Default: no

Create a backup file including the timestamp information so you can get the original file back if you somehow clobbered it incorrectly.

apk.description: Manages I(apk) packages for Alpine Linux.

Indicates the desired package(s) state.
C(present) ensures the package(s) is/are present.
C(absent) ensures the package(s) is/are absent.
C(latest) ensures the package(s) is/are present and the latest version(s).

upgrade.description: Upgrade all installed packages to their latest version.

update_cache.description: Update repository indexes. Can be run with other steps or on it's own.

name.description: A package name, like C(foo), or mutliple packages, like C(foo, bar).

bigpanda.description: Notify BigPanda when deployments start and end (successfully or not). Returns a deployment object containing all the parameters for future module calls.

Default: machine's hostname

Name of affected host name. Can be a list.

owner.description: The person responsible for the deployment.

validate_certs.description:
Default: yes

If C(no), SSL certificates for the target url will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

win_iis_webapplication.description: Creates, Removes and configures a IIS Web applications

application_pool.description: The application pool in which the new site executes.

name.description: Name of the Web applicatio

physical_path.description: The physical path on the remote host to use for the new applicatiojn. The specified folder must already exist.

site.description: Name of the site on which the application is created.

win_get_url.description: Fetches a file from a URL and saves to locally

username.description: Basic authentication username

force.description:
Default: True

If C(yes), will always download the file.  If C(no), will only download the file if it does not exist or the remote file has been modified more recently than the local file.

url.description: The full URL of a file to download

skip_certificate_validation.description: Skip SSL certificate validation if true

proxy_url.description: The full URL of the proxy server to download through.

dest.description: The absolute path of the location to save the file at the URL. Be sure to include a filename and extension as appropriate.

password.description: Basic authentication password

rpm_key.description: Adds or removes (rpm --import) a gpg key to your rpm database.

state.description:
Default: present

Wheather the key will be imported or removed from the rpm db.

validate_certs.description:
Default: yes

If C(no) and the C(key) is a url starting with https, SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

key.description: Key that will be modified. Can be a url, a file, or a keyid if the key already exists in the database.

from.description:
Default: Ansible

Name the message will appear be sent from. max 15 characters. Over 15, will be shorten.

room.description: ID or name of the room.

color.description:
Default: yellow

Background color for the message. Default is yellow.

msg_format.description:
Default: text

message format. html or text. Default is text.

api.description:
Default: https://api.hipchat.com/v1

API url if using a self-hosted hipchat server. For hipchat api version 2 use C(/v2) path in URI

notify.description:
Default: yes

notify or not (change the tab color, play a sound, etc)

validate_certs.description:
Default: yes

If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

rax_scaling_policy.description: Manipulate Rackspace Cloud Autoscale Scaling Policy

is_percent.description: Whether the value in I(change) is a percent value

name.description: Name to give the policy

scaling_group.description: Name of the scaling group that this policy will be added to

cron.description: The time when the policy will be executed, as a cron entry. For example, if this is parameter is set to C(1 0 * * *)

desired_capacity.description: The desired server capacity of the scaling the group; that is, how many servers should be in the scaling group.

state.description:
Default: present

Indicate desired state of the resource

cooldown.description: The period of time, in seconds, that must pass before any scaling can occur after the previous scaling. Must be an integer between 0 and 86400 (24 hrs).

at.description: The UTC time when this policy will be executed. The time must be formatted according to C(yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSS) such as C(2013-05-19T08:07:08Z)

policy_type.description: The type of policy that will be executed for the current release.

change.description: The change, either as a number of servers or as a percentage, to make in the scaling group. If this is a percentage, you must set I(is_percent) to C(true) also.

dnf.description: Installs, upgrade, removes, and lists packages and groups with the I(dnf) package manager.

name.description: Package name, or package specifier with version, like C(name-1.0). When using state=latest, this can be '*' which means run: dnf -y update. You can also pass a url or a local path to a rpm file.

list.description: Various (non-idempotent) commands for usage with C(/usr/bin/ansible) and I(not) playbooks. See examples.

disable_gpg_check.description:
Default: no

Whether to disable the GPG checking of signatures of packages being installed. Has an effect only if state is I(present) or I(latest).

conf_file.description: The remote dnf configuration file to use for the transaction.

state.description:
Default: present

Whether to install (C(present), C(latest)), or remove (C(absent)) a package.

disablerepo.description: I(Repoid) of repositories to disable for the install/update operation. These repos will not persist beyond the transaction. When specifying multiple repos, separate them with a ",".

enablerepo.description: I(Repoid) of repositories to enable for the install/update operation. These repos will not persist beyond the transaction. When specifying multiple repos, separate them with a ",".

win_nssm.description: nssm is a service helper which doesn't suck. See https://nssm.cc/ for more information.

name.description: Name of the service to operate on

start_mode.description:
Default: auto

If C(auto) is selected, the service will start at bootup. C(manual) means that the service will start only when another service needs it. C(disabled) means that the service will stay off, regardless if it is needed or not.

application.description:
The application binary to run as a service
Specify this whenever the service may need to be installed (state: present, started, stopped, restarted)
Note that the application name must look like the following, if the directory includes spaces:
nssm install service "c:\Program Files\app.exe\" "C:\Path with spaces\"
See commit 0b386fc1984ab74ee59b7bed14b7e8f57212c22b in the nssm.git project for more info (https://git.nssm.cc/?p=nssm.git;a=commit;h=0b386fc1984ab74ee59b7bed14b7e8f57212c22b)

state.description:
Default: started

State of the service on the system
Note that NSSM actions like "pause", "continue", "rotate" do not fit the declarative style of ansible, so these should be implemented via the ansible command module

dependencies.description: Service dependencies that has to be started to trigger startup, separated by comma.

user.description: User to be used for service startup

password.description: Password to be used for service startup

app_parameters.description: Parameters to be passed to the application when it starts

bundler.description: Manage installation and Gem version dependencies for Ruby using the Bundler gem

executable.description: The path to the bundler executable

chdir.description:
Default: temporary working directory

The directory to execute the bundler commands from. This directoy needs to contain a valid Gemfile or .bundle/ directory

gemfile.description:
Default: Gemfile in current directory

Only applies if state is C(present). The path to the gemfile to use to install gems.

deployment_mode.description:
Default: no

Only applies if state is C(present). If set it will only install gems that are in the default or production groups. Requires a Gemfile.lock file to have been created prior

user_install.description:
Default: yes

Only applies if state is C(present). Installs gems in the local user's cache or for all users

extra_args.description: A space separated string of additional commands that can be applied to the Bundler command. Refer to the Bundler documentation for more information

state.description:
Default: present

The desired state of the Gem bundle. C(latest) updates gems to the most recent, acceptable version

clean.description:
Default: no

Only applies if state is C(present). If set removes any gems on the target host that are not in the gemfile

binstub_directory.description: Only applies if state is C(present). Specifies the directory to install any gem bins files to. When executed the bin files will run within the context of the Gemfile and fail if any required gem dependencies are not installed. If C(chdir) is set then this path is relative to C(chdir)

exclude_groups.description: A list of Gemfile groups to exclude during operations. This only applies when state is C(present). Bundler considers this a 'remembered' property for the Gemfile and will automatically exclude groups in future operations even if C(exclude_groups) is not set

local.description:
Default: no

If set only installs gems from the cache on the target host

gem_path.description:
Default: RubyGems gem paths

Only applies if state is C(present). Specifies the directory to install the gems into. If C(chdir) is set then this path is relative to C(chdir)

urpmi.description: Manages packages with I(urpmi) (such as for Mageia or Mandriva)

force.description:
Default: True

Assume "yes" is the answer to any question urpmi has to ask. Corresponds to the C(--force) option for I(urpmi).

state.description:
Default: present

Indicates the desired package state

update_cache.description: update the package database first C(urpmi.update -a).

pkg.description: name of package to install, upgrade or remove.

no-recommends.description:
Default: True

Corresponds to the C(--no-recommends) option for I(urpmi).

docker_login.description:
Ansible version of the "docker login" CLI command.
This module allows you to login to a Docker registry without directly pulling an image or performing any other actions.
It will write your login credentials to your local .dockercfg file that is compatible to the Docker CLI client as well as docker-py and all other Docker related modules that are based on docker-py.

username.description: The username for the registry account

dockercfg_path.description:
Default: ~/.docker/config.json

Use a custom path for the .dockercfg file

reauth.description: Whether refresh existing authentication on the Docker server (boolean)

registry.description:
Default: https://index.docker.io/v1/

URL of the registry, defaults to: https://index.docker.io/v1/

timeout.description:
Default: 600

The HTTP request timeout in seconds

password.description: The plaintext password for the registry account

email.description:
Default: None

The email address for the registry account. Note that private registries usually don't need this, but if you want to log into your Docker Hub account (default behaviour) you need to specify this in order to be able to log in.

vmware_vm_facts.description: Return basic facts pertaining to a vSphere virtual machine guest

username.description: The username of the vSphere vCenter

admin.description: The username of the vSphere vCenter

hostname.description: The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter API server

pwd.description: The password of the vSphere vCenter

user.description: The username of the vSphere vCenter

pass.description: The password of the vSphere vCenter

password.description: The password of the vSphere vCenter

username.description: The username of the vSphere vCenter

enable_ha.description: If set to True will enable HA when the cluster is created.

enable_vsan.description: If set to True will enable vSAN when the cluster is created.

datacenter_name.description: The name of the datacenter the cluster will be created in.

admin.description: The username of the vSphere vCenter

hostname.description: The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter

cluster_name.description: The name of the cluster that will be created

pwd.description: The password of the vSphere vCenter

enable_drs.description: If set to True will enable DRS when the cluster is created.

user.description: The username of the vSphere vCenter

pass.description: The password of the vSphere vCenter

password.description: The password of the vSphere vCenter

grove.description: The M(grove) module sends a message for a service to a Grove.io channel.

service.description:
Default: ansible

Name of the service (displayed as the "user" in the message)

url.description: Service URL for the web client

channel_token.description: Token of the channel to post to.

validate_certs.description:
Default: yes

If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

ec2_remote_facts.description: Gather facts about ec2 instances in AWS

filters.description: A dict of filters to apply. Each dict item consists of a filter key and a filter value. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeInstances.html) for possible filters.

os_keypair.description: Add or Remove key pair from OpenStack

public_key.description:
Default: None

The public key that would be uploaded to nova and injected into VMs upon creation.

state.description:
Default: present

Should the resource be present or absent.

public_key_file.description:
Default: None

Path to local file containing ssh public key. Mutually exclusive with public_key.

name.description:
Default: None

Name that has to be given to the key pair

region_name.description:
Default: None

Name of the region

enable_dhcp.description:
Default: True

Whether DHCP should be enabled for this subnet.

tenant_name.description:
Default: None

The name of the tenant for whom the subnet should be created

dns_nameservers.description:
Default: None

DNS nameservers for this subnet, comma-separated

login_tenant_name.description:
Default: True

The tenant name of the login user

state.description:
Default: present

Indicate desired state of the resource

allocation_pool_start.description:
Default: None

From the subnet pool the starting address from which the IP should be allocated

auth_url.description:
Default: http://127.0.0.1:35357/v2.0/

The keystone URL for authentication

login_password.description:
Default: True

Password of login user

login_username.description:
Default: admin

login username to authenticate to keystone

gateway_ip.description:
Default: None

The ip that would be assigned to the gateway for this subnet

cidr.description:
Default: None

The CIDR representation of the subnet that should be assigned to the subnet

network_name.description:
Default: None

Name of the network to which the subnet should be attached

ip_version.description:
Default: 4

The IP version of the subnet 4 or 6

allocation_pool_end.description:
Default: None

From the subnet pool the last IP that should be assigned to the virtual machines

name.description:
Default: None

The name of the subnet that should be created

ec2_vpc_route_table_facts.description: Gather facts about ec2 VPC route tables in AWS

filters.description: A dict of filters to apply. Each dict item consists of a filter key and a filter value. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeRouteTables.html) for possible filters.

known_hosts.description: The M(known_hosts) module lets you add or remove a host from the C(known_hosts) file. This is useful if you're going to want to use the M(git) module over ssh, for example. If you have a very large number of host keys to manage, you will find the M(template) module more useful.

host.description: The host to add or remove (must match a host specified in key)

path.description:
Default: (homedir)+/.ssh/known_hosts

The known_hosts file to edit

state.description:
Default: present

I(present) to add the host, I(absent) to remove it.

name.description: The host to add or remove (must match a host specified in key)

key.description: The SSH public host key, as a string (required if state=present, optional when state=absent, in which case all keys for the host are removed)

snmp_facts.description: Retrieve facts for a device using SNMP, the facts will be inserted to the ansible_facts key.

username.description: Username for SNMPv3, required if version is v3

privacy.description: Encryption algoritm, required if level is authPriv

level.description: Authentication level, required if version is v3

community.description: The SNMP community string, required if version is v2/v2c

authkey.description: Authentication key, required if version is v3

host.description: Set to target snmp server (normally {{inventory_hostname}})

version.description: SNMP Version to use, v2/v2c or v3

integrity.description: Hashing algoritm, required if version is v3

privkey.description: Encryption key, required if version is authPriv

setup.description: This module is automatically called by playbooks to gather useful variables about remote hosts that can be used in playbooks. It can also be executed directly by C(/usr/bin/ansible) to check what variables are available to a host. Ansible provides many I(facts) about the system, automatically.

filter.description:
Default: *

if supplied, only return facts that match this shell-style (fnmatch) wildcard.

fact_path.description:
Default: /etc/ansible/facts.d

path used for local ansible facts (*.fact) - files in this dir will be run (if executable) and their results be added to ansible_local facts if a file is not executable it is read. File/results format can be json or ini-format

cs_instance.description: Deploy, start, update, scale, restart, restore, stop and destroy instances.

domain.description: Domain the instance is related to.

force.description: Force stop/start the instance if required to apply changes, otherwise a running instance will not be changed.

disk_offering.description: Name of the disk offering to be used.

keyboard.description: Keyboard device type for the instance.

user_data.description:
Optional data (ASCII) that can be sent to the instance upon a successful deployment.
The data will be automatically base64 encoded.
Consider switching to HTTP_POST by using C(CLOUDSTACK_METHOD=post) to increase the HTTP_GET size limit of 2KB to 32 KB.

root_disk_size.description: Root disk size in GByte required if deploying instance with KVM hypervisor and want resize the root disk size at startup (need CloudStack >= 4.4, cloud-initramfs-growroot installed and enabled in the template)

cpu_speed.description: The clock speed/shares allocated to the instance, used with custom service offerings

ip6_address.description: IPv6 address for default instance's network.

networks.description: List of networks to use for the new instance.

security_groups.description: List of security groups the instance to be applied to.

group.description: Group in where the new instance should be in.

network.description: List of networks to use for the new instance.

zone.description:
Name of the zone in which the instance shoud be deployed.
If not set, default zone is used.

state.description:
Default: present

State of the instance.

template.description:
Name or id of the template to be used for creating the new instance.
Required when using C(state=present).
Mutually exclusive with C(ISO) option.

memory.description: The memory allocated to the instance, used with custom service offerings

iso.description:
Name or id of the ISO to be used for creating the new instance.
Required when using C(state=present).
Mutually exclusive with C(template) option.

ip_to_network.description:
List of mappings in the form {'network': NetworkName, 'ip': 1.2.3.4}
Mutually exclusive with C(networks) option.

tags.description:
List of tags. Tags are a list of dictionaries having keys C(key) and C(value).
If you want to delete all tags, set a empty list e.g. C(tags: []).

ssh_key.description: Name of the SSH key to be deployed on the new instance.

affinity_group.description: Affinity groups names to be applied to the new instance.

display_name.description:
Custom display name of the instances.
Display name will be set to C(name) if not specified.
Either C(name) or C(display_name) is required.

service_offering.description:
Name or id of the service offering of the new instance.
If not set, first found service offering is used.

ip_address.description: IPv4 address for default instance's network during creation.

account.description: Account the instance is related to.

disk_size.description: Disk size in GByte required if deploying instance from ISO.

name.description:
Host name of the instance. C(name) can only contain ASCII letters.
Name will be generated (UUID) by CloudStack if not specified and can not be changed afterwards.
Either C(name) or C(display_name) is required.

hypervisor.description:
Name the hypervisor to be used for creating the new instance.
Relevant when using C(state=present), but only considered if not set on ISO/template.
If not set or found on ISO/template, first found hypervisor will be used.

ip_to_networks.description:
List of mappings in the form {'network': NetworkName, 'ip': 1.2.3.4}
Mutually exclusive with C(networks) option.

project.description: Name of the project the instance to be deployed in.

affinity_groups.description: Affinity groups names to be applied to the new instance.

security_group.description: List of security groups the instance to be applied to.

poll_async.description:
Default: True

Poll async jobs until job has finished.

cpu.description: The number of CPUs to allocate to the instance, used with custom service offerings

ec2_tag.description: Creates, removes and lists tags from any EC2 resource.  The resource is referenced by its resource id (e.g. an instance being i-XXXXXXX). It is designed to be used with complex args (tags), see the examples.  This module has a dependency on python-boto.

state.description:
Default: present

Whether the tags should be present or absent on the resource. Use list to interrogate the tags of an instance.

tags.description: a hash/dictionary of tags to add to the resource; '{"key":"value"}' and '{"key":"value","key":"value"}'

rds_subnet_group.description: Creates, modifies, and deletes RDS database subnet groups. This module has a dependency on python-boto >= 2.5.

subnets.description: List of subnet IDs that make up the database subnet group.

state.description:
Default: present

Specifies whether the subnet should be present or absent.

name.description: Database subnet group identifier.

description.description: Database subnet group description. Only set when a new group is added.

fetch.description: This module works like M(copy), but in reverse. It is used for fetching files from remote machines and storing them locally in a file tree, organized by hostname. Note that this module is written to transfer log files that might not be present, so a missing remote file won't be an error unless fail_on_missing is set to 'yes'.

src.description: The file on the remote system to fetch. This I(must) be a file, not a directory. Recursive fetching may be supported in a later release.

flat.description: Allows you to override the default behavior of appending hostname/path/to/file to the destination.  If dest ends with '/', it will use the basename of the source file, similar to the copy module. Obviously this is only handy if the filenames are unique.

dest.description: A directory to save the file into. For example, if the I(dest) directory is C(/backup) a I(src) file named C(/etc/profile) on host C(host.example.com), would be saved into C(/backup/host.example.com/etc/profile)

validate_md5.description:
Default: yes

Verify that the source and destination checksums match after the files are fetched.

validate_checksum.description:
Default: yes

Verify that the source and destination checksums match after the files are fetched.

fail_on_missing.description:
Default: no

Makes it fails when the source file is missing.

pushbullet.description: This module sends push notifications via Pushbullet to channels or devices.

body.description: Body of the notification, e.g. Details of the fault you're alerting.

push_type.description:
Default: note

Thing you wish to push.

device.description: The device NAME you wish to send a push notification, as seen on the Pushbullet main page.

channel.description: The channel TAG you wish to broadcast a push notification, as seen on the "My Channels" > "Edit your channel" at Pushbullet page.

device_mapping.description:
An optional list of device hashes/dictionaries with custom configurations (same block-device-mapping parameters)
Valid properties include: device_name, volume_type, size (in GB), delete_on_termination (boolean), no_device (boolean), snapshot_id, iops (for io1 volume_type)

description.description: An optional human-readable string describing the contents and purpose of the AMI.

tags.description: a hash/dictionary of tags to add to the new image; '{"key":"value"}' and '{"key":"value","key":"value"}'

launch_permissions.description: Users and groups that should be able to launch the ami. Expects dictionary with a key of user_ids and/or group_names. user_ids should be a list of account ids. group_name should be a list of groups, "all" is the only acceptable value currently.

delete_snapshot.description: Whether or not to delete an AMI while deregistering it.

no_reboot.description: An optional flag indicating that the bundling process should not attempt to shutdown the instance before bundling. If this flag is True, the responsibility of maintaining file system integrity is left to the owner of the instance. The default choice is "no".

instance_id.description: instance id of the image to create

state.description:
Default: present

create or deregister/delete image

wait_timeout.description:
Default: 300

how long before wait gives up, in seconds

wait.description:
Default: no

wait for the AMI to be in state 'available' before returning.

name.description: The name of the new image to create

cloudtrail.description: Creates or deletes CloudTrail configuration. Ensures logging is also enabled.

aws_secret_key.description: AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.

access_key.description: AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.

aws_access_key.description: AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.

name.description:
name for given CloudTrail configuration.
This is a primary key and is used to identify the configuration.

region.description: The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used.

include_global_events.description: record API calls from global services such as IAM and STS?

aws_region.description: The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used.

state.description: add or remove CloudTrail configuration.

s3_bucket_prefix.description:
bucket to place CloudTrail in.
this bucket should exist and have the proper policy. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/awscloudtrail/latest/userguide/aggregating_logs_regions_bucket_policy.html)
required when state=enabled.

ec2_access_key.description: AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.

secret_key.description: AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.

ec2_secret_key.description: AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.

s3_key_prefix.description: prefix to keys in bucket. A trailing slash is not necessary and will be removed.

ec2_region.description: The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used.

os_ironic.description: Create or Remove Ironic nodes from OpenStack.

uuid.description:
Default: None

globally unique identifier (UUID) to be given to the resource. Will be auto-generated if not specified, and name is specified.
Definition of a UUID will always take precedence to a name value.

driver_info.description: Information for this server's driver. Will vary based on which driver is in use. Any sub-field which is populated will be validated during creation.

nics.description: A list of network interface cards, eg, " - mac: aa:bb:cc:aa:bb:cc"

driver.description:
Default: None

The name of the Ironic Driver to use with this node.

ironic_url.description:
Default: None

If noauth mode is utilized, this is required to be set to the endpoint URL for the Ironic API.  Use with "auth" and "auth_type" settings set to None.

state.description:
Default: present

Indicates desired state of the resource

chassis_uuid.description:
Default: None

Associate the node with a pre-defined chassis.

skip_update_of_driver_password.description: Allows the code that would assert changes to nodes to skip the update if the change is a single line consisting of the password field.  As of Kilo, by default, passwords are always masked to API requests, which means the logic as a result always attempts to re-assert the password field.

properties.description: Definition of the physical characteristics of this server, used for scheduling purposes

name.description:
Default: None

unique name identifier to be given to the resource.

lineinfile.description:
This module will search a file for a line, and ensure that it is present or absent.
This is primarily useful when you want to change a single line in a file only. See the M(replace) module if you want to change multiple, similar lines; for other cases, see the M(copy) or M(template) modules.

name.description: The file to modify.

insertbefore.description: Used with C(state=present). If specified, the line will be inserted before the last match of specified regular expression. A value is available; C(BOF) for inserting the line at the beginning of the file. If specified regular expresion has no matches, the line will be inserted at the end of the file.  May not be used with C(backrefs).

dest.description: The file to modify.

create.description:
Default: no

Used with C(state=present). If specified, the file will be created if it does not already exist. By default it will fail if the file is missing.

backrefs.description:
Default: no

Used with C(state=present). If set, line can contain backreferences (both positional and named) that will get populated if the C(regexp) matches. This flag changes the operation of the module slightly; C(insertbefore) and C(insertafter) will be ignored, and if the C(regexp) doesn't match anywhere in the file, the file will be left unchanged. If the C(regexp) does match, the last matching line will be replaced by the expanded line parameter.

state.description:
Default: present

Whether the line should be there or not.

others.description: All arguments accepted by the M(file) module also work here.

insertafter.description:
Default: EOF

Used with C(state=present). If specified, the line will be inserted after the last match of specified regular expression. A special value is available; C(EOF) for inserting the line at the end of the file. If specified regular expresion has no matches, EOF will be used instead. May not be used with C(backrefs).

regexp.description: The regular expression to look for in every line of the file. For C(state=present), the pattern to replace if found; only the last line found will be replaced. For C(state=absent), the pattern of the line to remove.  Uses Python regular expressions; see U(http://docs.python.org/2/library/re.html).

line.description: Required for C(state=present). The line to insert/replace into the file. If C(backrefs) is set, may contain backreferences that will get expanded with the C(regexp) capture groups if the regexp matches.

backup.description:
Default: no

Create a backup file including the timestamp information so you can get the original file back if you somehow clobbered it incorrectly.

gce_net.description: This module can create and destroy Google Compute Engine networks and firewall rules U(https://developers.google.com/compute/docs/networking). The I(name) parameter is reserved for referencing a network while the I(fwname) parameter is used to reference firewall rules. IPv4 Address ranges must be specified using the CIDR U(http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Classless_Inter-Domain_Routing) format. Full install/configuration instructions for the gce* modules can be found in the comments of ansible/test/gce_tests.py.

Default: present

allowed.description: the protocol:ports to allow ('tcp:80' or 'tcp:80,443' or 'tcp:80-800;udp:1-25')

cidr.description: the IPv4 address range in CIDR notation for the network

target_tags.description: the target instance tags for creating a firewall rule

src_cidr.description: the source IPv4 address range in CIDR notation

disks.description: a list of persistent disks to attach to the instance; a string value gives the name of the disk; alternatively, a dictionary value can define 'name' and 'mode' ('READ_ONLY' or 'READ_WRITE'). The first entry will be the boot disk (which must be READ_WRITE).

disk_auto_delete.description:

if set boot disk will be removed after instance destruction

s3.description: This module allows the user to manage S3 buckets and the objects within them. Includes support for creating and deleting both objects and buckets, retrieving objects as files or strings and generating download links. This module has a dependency on python-boto.

prefix.description: Limits the response to keys that begin with the specified prefix for list mode

marker.description: Specifies the key to start with when using list mode. Object keys are returned in alphabetical order, starting with key after the marker in order.

overwrite.description:
Default: True

Force overwrite either locally on the filesystem or remotely with the object/key. Used with PUT and GET operations. Boolean or one of [Always, Never, Different], new in 2.0

aws_secret_key.description: AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.

encrypt.description: When set for PUT mode, asks for server-side encryption

expiration.description:
Default: 600

Time limit (in seconds) for the URL generated and returned by S3/Walrus when performing a mode=put or mode=geturl operation.

retries.description: On recoverable failure, how many times to retry before actually failing.

max_keys.description:
Default: 1000

Max number of results to return in list mode, set this if you want to retrieve fewer than the default 1000 keys.

version.description: Version ID of the object inside the bucket. Can be used to get a specific version of a file if versioning is enabled in the target bucket.

s3_url.description: S3 URL endpoint for usage with Eucalypus, fakes3, etc.  Otherwise assumes AWS

metadata.description: Metadata for PUT operation, as a dictionary of 'key=value' and 'key=value,key=value'.

permission.description:
Default: private

This option let's the user set the canned permissions on the object/bucket that are created. The permissions that can be set are 'private', 'public-read', 'public-read-write', 'authenticated-read'. Multiple permissions can be specified as a list.

dest.description: The destination file path when downloading an object/key with a GET operation.

object.description: Keyname of the object inside the bucket. Can be used to create "virtual directories", see examples.

ec2_access_key.description: AWS access key id. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.

ec2_secret_key.description: AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.

S3_URL.description: S3 URL endpoint for usage with Eucalypus, fakes3, etc.  Otherwise assumes AWS

access_key.description: AWS access key id. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.

src.description: The source file path when performing a PUT operation.

aws_access_key.description: AWS access key id. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.

region.description: AWS region to create the bucket in. If not set then the value of the AWS_REGION and EC2_REGION environment variables are checked, followed by the aws_region and ec2_region settings in the Boto config file.  If none of those are set the region defaults to the S3 Location: US Standard.  Prior to ansible 1.8 this parameter could be specified but had no effect.

headers.description: Custom headers for PUT operation, as a dictionary of 'key=value' and 'key=value,key=value'.

mode.description: Switches the module behaviour between put (upload), get (download), geturl (return download url, Ansible 1.3+), getstr (download object as string (1.3+)), list (list keys, Ansible 2.0+), create (bucket), delete (bucket), and delobj (delete object, Ansible 2.0+).

secret_key.description: AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.

nodeps.description: Only merge packages but not their dependencies (--nodeps)

getbinpkg.description: Prefer packages specified at PORTAGE_BINHOST in make.conf

onlydeps.description: Only merge packages' dependencies but not the packages (--onlydeps)

newuse.description: Include installed packages where USE flags have changed (--newuse)

package.description: Package atom or set, e.g. C(sys-apps/foo) or C(>foo-2.13) or C(@world)

oneshot.description: Do not add the packages to the world file (--oneshot)

update.description: Update packages to the best version available (--update)

deep.description: Consider the entire dependency tree of packages (--deep)

sync.description:
Sync package repositories first
If yes, perform "emerge --sync"
If web, perform "emerge-webrsync"

changed_use.description:
Include installed packages where USE flags have changed, except when
flags that the user has not enabled are added or removed
(--changed-use)

state.description:
Default: present

State of the package atom

usepkgonly.description: Merge only binaries (no compiling). This sets getbinpkg=yes.

depclean.description:
Remove packages not needed by explicitly merged packages (--depclean)
If no package is specified, clean up the world's dependencies
Otherwise, --depclean serves as a dependency aware version of --unmerge

pkgin.description: The standard package manager for SmartOS, but also usable on NetBSD or any OS that uses C(pkgsrc).  (Home: U(http://pkgin.net/))

name.description:

multiple names may be given, separated by commas

A trivial test module, this module always returns C(pong) on successful contact. It does not make sense in playbooks, but it is useful from C(/usr/bin/ansible) to verify the ability to login and that a usable python is configured.
This is NOT ICMP ping, this is just a trivial test module.
